intro: Cyclosorus krameri, commonly known as the creeping liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Marchantiaceae. It is a small, mat-forming species that thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rocks or soil surfaces. The plant has a thalloid structure with a dorsiventral differentiation, typical of liverworts. Its reproductive structures include archegonia and antheridia, which are located on specialized shoots. Cyclosorus krameri plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
